Due to some potentially severe budget cuts for the next school year, and an attempt to save money ahead of time, all Vernonia Schools and activities will be closed and cancelled this Friday, May 15, and likely all remaining Fridays in May and June.

Attention that this will impact all families receiving free breakfast and lunches for their children from the school.
Because we will be closed on Fridays we will begin sending home two days worth of meals on Thursdays. These meals can still be picked up at school between 11am-Noon on Thursdays, or they will still be delivered by bus on Thursdays if that is how you normally receive them.

Again, the VSD will no longer have meal pickup and delivery on Fridays. Double meals will be provided on Thursdays to make up for this inconvenience.

If you have any questions, please call the school at 503-429-1333. Thank you.

This week is dedicated to teachers across our nation. Please join VSD in recognizing our amazing teachers. The below note is from Superintendent Miller.

Happy Teacher Appreciation Week!!!

We can't thank you, our teachers, enough for all you do to take care of the children in our community!

You are there for them when they are hurt, happy, hungry, excited, upset, in need of someone to listen, in need of someone to be proud of them, and none of that has anything to do with the day job of teaching academics.

You are amazing people and we thank you for all you do for our kids! Even though we don't get to see you this week, know we are thinking about you!

Now, more than ever, the rest of the world is appreciating you, too! Keep up the good work!

A message from Ms. Ward and the VMS Teaching Staff:
"Dear Middle School Parents and Students,
The middle school staff is working to put together materials and resources that will help your student learn and grow during this uncharted time. Please be patient with us as we want to roll out a plan as smoothly as possible to allow lower levels of frustration for all. We are all new to this type of situation. One thing we do know is that this community will rally and come together as we did during the year of the flood.
We, as a team, have been gathering ideas and activities that will help your students review and maintain until we are ready to go with lessons that coordinate with the Oregon Department of Education. Review activities and ideas will be added below so make sure you save this. Thank you always for your support. We miss your kids and can't wait to see them in our classrooms again soon even if it looks a little different than normal."

Sophomore Brooklynn Walters led the Lady Loggers with 19 points, including 4 3-point baskets, junior Jayden Hartman scored 11, and seniors Jordan Walters and Lauren Ely both added 10 points to a well rounded Logger offense. Senior Abby Coleman again had a strong defensive game, as did Hartman. Following the game Hartman was named League Defensive Player of the Year and received 3rd Team All League honors, Brooklynn and Jordan Walters were both named 1st Team All League, and Ely was named 2nd Team.

May 23, 2019 at 8:26 AM ·

The VHS Lady Loggers made short work of Santiam in the state softball playoffs on Wednesday, May 22, defeating the Wildcats 11-0 in 5 innings to reach the final 8. Senior pitcher Joyce Everett was dominant in recording the shutout and also chipped in a home run for the Lady Logger offense, which was aggressive at the plate - freshmen Brooklynn Walters also hit a home run and Nita Cook added 2 triples. Vernonia's defense was also sharp, led by shortstop Cook, second baseman Tomi Oata, first baseman Jordan Walters, and right fielder Jessica Butcher, who made several key plays. Coach Ernie Smith's #6 seeded squad will now travel to Toledo on Friday May 24 to face the #3 ranked Boomers. Let's Go Loggers!

Once again VSD came away with a winner that will head to the State Fair this August to compete at the State Spelling Bee.

On this Wednesday, teachers across the State of Oregon are leaving their classrooms for the day to protest the lack of educational funding. Instead of taking the full day away from their students, our teachers chose to show support for their fellow teachers across the State by walking out the first 15 minutes of the day and then returning back into the classroom to show support for our students.

While our teachers, available classified staff, and supportive community members were outside, elementary, middle and high school students each had a separate assembly to discuss Teacher Appreciation Week and the reason for the walk-out and why it was happening. These assemblies were led by administrative staff. VSD is incredibly grateful to our Vernonia Education Association for their efforts with this very important topic.
Photo credit: B. Carr

Oregon Immunization Exclusion Day is coming up! Please read the following note from our School Nurse.

Oregon law requires that all children attending public/private schools show evidence of compliance with the immunization requirements prior to February 20th or be excluded from school. If you received a letter stating that your child needs to have immunizations they can be seen at Spencer Health and Wellness, located at the school, please call 503-429-1399 or 1-800-244-4870 to schedule an appointment. If your child has not been seen yet at the clinic, you will need to fill out new patient forms. We must have confirmation by Tuesday, February 19th or your child will not be able to attend school.

Lakeside School is a private school in Seattle, Washington. Each year for the past four years, 8th graders from Lakeside School have visited the Vernonia School District for one full week to learn about our community, and work on service projects here in Vernonia.
They have:
•Learned about Vernonia, its floods, and their impacts on the community
•Participated in our annual Salmon Watch event
•Performed water quality testing activities with our Forestry students
•Participated in outdoor learning projects at Stub Stewart State Park
•Cleaned up the Museum
•Spent time with our eighth grade students both in and out of class
•Helped elementary students and their teachers in the classroom

Thank you Lakeside School - It was a pleasure having you!
